-| wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(cfv(csca, c0), ccms)), wa(wcel(c3, ccms), wcel(c1, cfv(clss, c0)))), wcel(c3, cbn))
-| wceq(c3, co(c0, cress, c1))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(ccss, c0))
-| wceq(cfv(clss, c0), cfv(clss, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (((c0 ∈ Ban ∧ c0 ∈ CPreHil)∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ c3 ∈ Ban)
⊣ (((c0 ∈ NrmVec ∧(Scalar ` c0)∈ CMetSp)∧(c3 ∈ CMetSp ∧ c1 ∈(LSubSp ` c0)))→ c3 ∈ Ban)
⊣ c3 =(c0[|`s]c1)
⊣ c2 =(ClSubSp ` c0)
⊣ (LSubSp ` c0)=(LSubSp ` c0)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(cfv(csca, c0), ccms)), wa(wcel(c3, ccms), wcel(c1, cfv(clss, c0)))), wcel(c3, cbn))
-| wceq(c3, co(c0, cress, c1))
-| wceq(cfv(clss, c0), cfv(clss, c0))
body.pretty:
⊢ (((c0 ∈ NrmVec ∧(Scalar ` c0)∈ CMetSp)∧(c3 ∈ CMetSp ∧ c1 ∈(LSubSp ` c0)))→ c3 ∈ Ban)
⊣ c3 =(c0[|`s]c1)
⊣ (LSubSp ` c0)=(LSubSp ` c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cbn), wcel(c0, ccph)), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c3, cbn))
-| wceq(c3, co(c0, cress, c1))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(ccss, c0))
-| wceq(cfv(clss, c0), cfv(clss, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (((c0 ∈ Ban ∧ c0 ∈ CPreHil)∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ c3 ∈ Ban)
⊣ c3 =(c0[|`s]c1)
⊣ c2 =(ClSubSp ` c0)
⊣ (LSubSp ` c0)=(LSubSp ` c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cbn), wcel(c0, ccph)), wcel(c1, c2)), wcel(c3, cbn))
-| wceq(c3, co(c0, cress, c1))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(ccss, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (((c0 ∈ Ban ∧ c0 ∈ CPreHil)∧ c1 ∈ c2)→ c3 ∈ Ban)
⊣ c3 =(c0[|`s]c1)
⊣ c2 =(ClSubSp ` c0)

comment: A closed subspace of a Banach space which is also a subcomplex pre-Hilbert space is a Banach space. Remark: the assumption that the Banach space must be a (subcomplex) pre-Hilbert space is required because the definition of ` ClSubSp ` is based on an inner product. If ` ClSubSp ` was generalized for arbitrary topological spaces, this assuption could be omitted. (Contributed by AV, 8-Oct-2022.)
